workflow_plan.rationale: Verify the target quote exists to ensure valid entity_id, then upload the document to it for RAG enablement, confirming persistence via search or note.

success_path.description: Locate the target quote to obtain its quote_id as entity_id.
success_path.validation_hints: Must return a valid quote_id; empty list indicates non-existent quote.

success_path.description: Upload the document linked to the quote for RAG processing.
success_path.validation_hints: entity_type must be 'Quote'; entity_id must match a valid quote_id.

success_path.description: Log the document upload on the quote for audit trail.
success_path.validation_hints: entity_type='Quote'; content should reference the uploaded file_name.

failure_checks.description: Catch invalid entity references during upload.
failure_checks.validation_hints: Fails if entity_type not in [Opportunity, Contract, Quote, Client] or entity_id FK mismatch.

validation_notes: opportunity_id is a required string; used a realistic opportunity identifier format.
entity_type uses enum value 'Quote'; entity_id assumes output from prior step (realistic quote identifier); file_url is a valid URI; all required fields provided.

arguments.content: Document 'sales_proposal.pdf' uploaded for RAG processing on 2023-10-05.

validation_notes: entity_type uses enum value 'Quote'; entity_id matches prior step; content is a required descriptive string; audit trail purpose satisfied.

turns.content: Hey, I need to upload a sales proposal document for our opportunity OP-2023-001. Can you help with that?

Absolutely, happy to help get that document uploaded! First, I need to locate the associated quote for this opportunity to get the right quote_id. That way, we link everything properly. Invoking the quote_search tool now.
TOOL:{"name": "quote_search", "arguments": {"opportunity_id": "OP-2023-001"}}
Cool, found the quote? Now, the file is sales_proposal.pdf at https://secure.crmstorage.com/documents/sales_proposal.pdf.

Got it, the quote_id is QT-2023-001 from that search—perfect match! Now, let's upload the document directly to this quote for RAG processing. This ensures it's tied to the right entity. Invoking the upload_document tool.
TOOL:{"name": "upload_document", "arguments": {"entity_type": "Quote", "entity_id": "QT-2023-001", "file_name": "sales_proposal.pdf", "file_url": "https://secure.crmstorage.com/documents/sales_proposal.pdf"}}
Upload done? Just want to make sure it's logged properly.

Upload successful—everything's in place! To keep our audit trail clean, I'll add a note to the quote referencing the upload and date. This helps with tracking down the line. Invoking the add_note tool.
TOOL:{"name": "add_note", "arguments": {"entity_type": "Quote", "entity_id": "QT-2023-001", "content": "Document 'sales_proposal.pdf' uploaded for RAG processing on 2023-10-05."}}

conversation_text.summary: Successfully located quote QT-2023-001 for opportunity OP-2023-001, uploaded sales_proposal.pdf for RAG processing, and added audit note to the quote.
